intro: Pasania laotica, commonly known as the Laotian pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
